column5: While fishing for panfish today on Rice Lake. Chris hooked up to a chunk of a largemouth. Close to a 5lb bucket. Quick photo and back down the hole. Good fight for a sluggish winter fish.
Nice. It seems that they are more yellow brown in the winter. Possibly to match the colour of the dead weeds?

We tried a new spot and it worked out. We caught a bluegill for Ben's Panfish Derby which won second place for Steve Hatton. Chris caught this bucket and I straightened the hook out on something large as well. Those little panfish baits get beat up by big fish in the winter.  A nice little surprise.
With Chirs' record on Rice, I'll bet he's seen that fish before.
Now that he knows where it lives, you will probably see him holding that fish on a stage this summer.  That's all he needs is another big bass spot on Rice Lake.
